title: Intensive animal farming
summary: Intensive animal farming or industrial livestock production, also known by its opponents as factory farming,[1] is a type of intensive agriculture, specifically an approach to animal husbandry designed to maximize production, while minimizing costs.[2] To achieve this, agribusinesses keep livestock such as cattle, poultry, and fish at high stocking densities, at large scale, and using modern machinery, biotechnology, and global trade.[3][4][5][6][7] The main products of this industry are meat, milk and eggs for human consumption.[8] There are issues regarding whether intensive animal farming is sustainable[9] or ethical.[10]
